intro: Gonzalea sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower gonzalea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. Gonzalea sessiliflora is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
